Description: Discoid weight in terracotta, pierced with two small holes in upper part; possibly loom weight.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Chautauqua Institution, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

No photography is available for this weight because this object is now lost. Brief description ('terracotta discoid pierced’) with sketch from Chautauqua distribution list of the Egypt Exploration Fund.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TB.42) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Chautauqua Institution, Chautauqua (NY)
